page.title: 16Muirland School,Arden 1.
page.content: The old school was built in 1869 by the Laird of Luss. It was used as a school,Sunday school and a church. The minister used to put his horse and trap in a shed where the big bale silage is now stored. The school was lit by paraffin lamps which were lowered from the roof.It was heated by a stove and an open fire. There is a big bell up in the roof which was used by the school and the church. Some children used to walk at least two miles to school. They brought a packed lunch and a hot drink of cocoa was provided .During the war there were at least sixty children and two teachers in the school.In 1968 there was a terrible storm which blew down the play shed. There was no secretary until 1969. The new building was built in 1970.
